faq: What if I vomit after taking Dolo 650 Tablet?

If you vomit in less than 30 minutes after having a dose of Dolo 650 Tablet tablets or syrup, retake the same dose again. If you vomit after 30 minutes of a dose, you do not need to take another one until the next standard dose.
When will I feel better after taking the Dolo 650 Tablet?
Usually, you will start feeling better after about half an hour of taking a Dolo 650 Tablet.
How often can I take the Dolo 650 Tablet?

You should only take four doses of Dolo 650 Tablet in 24 hours. There should be a gap of at least 4 hours between two doses. Do not take Dolo 650 Tablet for more than 3 days without consulting a doctor first.
Does Dolo 650 Tablet make babies sleepy?
No, Dolo 650 Tablet does not make babies sleepy. It is a pain-relieving medicine that is also used to control high fever.
Is Dolo 650 Tablet safe for children?
Dolo 650 Tablet is considered safe for children only when used as directed by the doctor.
Is Dolo 650 Tablet an antibiotic?
No, Dolo 650 Tablet is not an antibiotic. It works as a painkiller and fever-reducing medicine.
Can I take Dolo 650 Tablet and ibuprofen together?
Ibuprofen and Dolo 650 Tablet are safe medicines, but both should not be used together. Consult your doctor if you are not sure.
How long does a Dolo 650 Tablet take to work?

Dolo 650 Tablet takes around 30-45 min to start working and show its effects. It is advised to take this medicine for the duration suggested by the doctor. Consult your doctor if you experience any bothersome side effects.
What are the serious side effects of taking an excess of the Dolo 650 Tablet?

Overdose of Dolo 650 Tablete may cause severe life-threatening liver injury. Taking more than the prescribed dose may also cause kidney injury, decreased platelet count, and even coma. Early symptoms of an overdose include nausea, vomiting, and general tiredness. Immediately consult a doctor or reach an emergency in case of a suspected overdose.

faq: How much Calpol 250mg Paediatric Oral Suspension Strawberry should I give to my child?

Always follow your doctor's instructions regarding how much of the medicine to give and how often to give it. This depends on the strength of the medicine and the age of your child. You may also check the label or the leaflet inside the packaging for directions before use. The commonly recommended dose is 10-15 mg/kg per dose every 4 to 6 hours. In case you are not sure how much to give, consult your child’s doctor.
When will my child’s condition improve after taking Calpol 250mg Paediatric Oral Suspension Strawberry?

Calpol 250mg Paediatric Oral Suspension Strawberry usually starts working within 30 to 60 mins of intake and shows its peak effect within 3 to 4 hours. Your child may start to feel better after a few doses. In case the pain or fever persists longer, consult your child’s doctor immediately.
Can I give Calpol 250mg Paediatric Oral Suspension Strawberry to my child for low-grade fever?
You can give this medicine if your child has a temperature of 38.3°C (101°F) or higher. But, you must always try to speak to your child’s doctor first.
My child’s fever is persistent even after taking Calpol 250mg Paediatric Oral Suspension Strawberry. What should I do?
If the fever doesn't come down after the initial few doses, the cause might be an infection (virus or bacteria). It is advised to consult your child’s doctor for specific treatment.
How much of Calpol 250mg Paediatric Oral Suspension Strawberry is considered as an overdose?

You should only take four doses of Calpol 250mg Paediatric Oral Suspension Strawberry in 24 hours. There should be a gap of at least 4-6 hours between two doses. Do not take it for more than 3 days without first talking to your doctor. Based on the dose, more than 250 mg/kg can lead to toxicity and can be potentially fatal. An overdose is capable of causing serious damage to the liver and kidneys. Inform your doctor immediately if you think you have given too much of this medicine to your child, even if your child seems well, because of the risk of delayed, serious liver damage.
Is there any special diet my child needs to follow while taking this medicine?
Unless instructed by your doctor, your child should take a normal balanced diet while continuing this medicine as lack of nutrition can put your child at risk of developing medicinal toxicity.
Where should I store this medicine?
Keep this medicine at room temperature in a dry place beyond the reach of the children.
In what conditions Calpol 250mg Paediatric Oral Suspension Strawberry must be given with caution?

It is advised to use Calpol 250mg Paediatric Oral Suspension Strawberry with caution if the child has malnutrition, G6PD deficiency, liver disease, or any medicinal allergy. So, do not hesitate to share your child’s complete medical history with the doctor as that will help the doctor decide whether the medicine is safe for your child or not.
Can I give Calpol 250mg Paediatric Oral Suspension Strawberry on a routine basis when my child is taking a vaccine?

Calpol 250mg Paediatric Oral Suspension Strawberry usually do not interfere with the ingredients in vaccines or cause a bad reaction in a child who has just been vaccinated. However, it is best if you let your child recover from the ongoing illness and finish the course of the medicine As soon as a child is feeling better the vaccine can and should be given.

faq: How much Dolo 250 Oral Suspension should I give to my child?

Always follow your doctor's instructions regarding how much of the medicine to give and how often to give it. This depends on the strength of the medicine and the age of your child. You may also check the label or the leaflet inside the packaging for directions before use. The commonly recommended dose is 10-15 mg/kg per dose every 4 to 6 hours. In case you are not sure how much to give, consult your child’s doctor.
When will my child’s condition improve after taking Dolo 250 Oral Suspension?

Dolo 250 Oral Suspension usually starts working within 30 to 60 mins of intake and shows its peak effect within 3 to 4 hours. Your child may start to feel better after a few doses. In case the pain or fever persists longer, consult your child’s doctor immediately.
Can I give Dolo 250 Oral Suspension to my child for low-grade fever?
You can give this medicine if your child has a temperature of 38.3°C (101°F) or higher. But, you must always try to speak to your child’s doctor first.
My child’s fever is persistent even after taking Dolo 250 Oral Suspension. What should I do?
If the fever doesn't come down after the initial few doses, the cause might be an infection (virus or bacteria). It is advised to consult your child’s doctor for specific treatment.
How much of Dolo 250 Oral Suspension is considered as an overdose?

You should only take four doses of Dolo 250 Oral Suspension in 24 hours. There should be a gap of at least 4-6 hours between two doses. Do not take it for more than 3 days without first talking to your doctor. Based on the dose, more than 250 mg/kg can lead to toxicity and can be potentially fatal. An overdose is capable of causing serious damage to the liver and kidneys. Inform your doctor immediately if you think you have given too much of this medicine to your child, even if your child seems well, because of the risk of delayed, serious liver damage.
Is there any special diet my child needs to follow while taking this medicine?
Unless instructed by your doctor, your child should take a normal balanced diet while continuing this medicine as lack of nutrition can put your child at risk of developing medicinal toxicity.
Where should I store this medicine?
Keep this medicine at room temperature in a dry place beyond the reach of the children.
In what conditions Dolo 250 Oral Suspension must be given with caution?

It is advised to use Dolo 250 Oral Suspension with caution if the child has malnutrition, G6PD deficiency, liver disease, or any medicinal allergy. So, do not hesitate to share your child’s complete medical history with the doctor as that will help the doctor decide whether the medicine is safe for your child or not.
Can I give Dolo 250 Oral Suspension on a routine basis when my child is taking a vaccine?

Dolo 250 Oral Suspension usually do not interfere with the ingredients in vaccines or cause a bad reaction in a child who has just been vaccinated. However, it is best if you let your child recover from the ongoing illness and finish the course of the medicine As soon as a child is feeling better the vaccine can and should be given.

faq: What if I vomit after taking Pacimol 650 Tablet?

If you vomit in less than 30 minutes after having a dose of Pacimol 650 Tablet tablets or syrup, retake the same dose again. If you vomit after 30 minutes of a dose, you do not need to take another one until the next standard dose.
When will I feel better after taking the Pacimol 650 Tablet?
Usually, you will start feeling better after about half an hour of taking a Pacimol 650 Tablet.
How often can I take the Pacimol 650 Tablet?

You should only take four doses of Pacimol 650 Tablet in 24 hours. There should be a gap of at least 4 hours between two doses. Do not take Pacimol 650 Tablet for more than 3 days without consulting a doctor first.
Does Pacimol 650 Tablet make babies sleepy?
No, Pacimol 650 Tablet does not make babies sleepy. It is a pain-relieving medicine that is also used to control high fever.
Is Pacimol 650 Tablet safe for children?
Pacimol 650 Tablet is considered safe for children only when used as directed by the doctor.
Is Pacimol 650 Tablet an antibiotic?
No, Pacimol 650 Tablet is not an antibiotic. It works as a painkiller and fever-reducing medicine.
Can I take Pacimol 650 Tablet and ibuprofen together?
Ibuprofen and Pacimol 650 Tablet are safe medicines, but both should not be used together. Consult your doctor if you are not sure.
How long does a Pacimol 650 Tablet take to work?

Pacimol 650 Tablet takes around 30-45 min to start working and show its effects. It is advised to take this medicine for the duration suggested by the doctor. Consult your doctor if you experience any bothersome side effects.
What are the serious side effects of taking an excess of the Pacimol 650 Tablet?

Overdose of Pacimol 650 Tablete may cause severe life-threatening liver injury. Taking more than the prescribed dose may also cause kidney injury, decreased platelet count, and even coma. Early symptoms of an overdose include nausea, vomiting, and general tiredness. Immediately consult a doctor or reach an emergency in case of a suspected overdose.

faq: How much Sumo L DS Suspension should I give to my child?

Always follow your doctor's instructions regarding how much of the medicine to give and how often to give it. This depends on the strength of the medicine and the age of your child. You may also check the label or the leaflet inside the packaging for directions before use. The commonly recommended dose is 10-15 mg/kg per dose every 4 to 6 hours. In case you are not sure how much to give, consult your child’s doctor.
When will my child’s condition improve after taking Sumo L DS Suspension?

Sumo L DS Suspension usually starts working within 30 to 60 mins of intake and shows its peak effect within 3 to 4 hours. Your child may start to feel better after a few doses. In case the pain or fever persists longer, consult your child’s doctor immediately.
Can I give Sumo L DS Suspension to my child for low-grade fever?
You can give this medicine if your child has a temperature of 38.3°C (101°F) or higher. But, you must always try to speak to your child’s doctor first.
My child’s fever is persistent even after taking Sumo L DS Suspension. What should I do?
If the fever doesn't come down after the initial few doses, the cause might be an infection (virus or bacteria). It is advised to consult your child’s doctor for specific treatment.
How much of Sumo L DS Suspension is considered as an overdose?

You should only take four doses of Sumo L DS Suspension in 24 hours. There should be a gap of at least 4-6 hours between two doses. Do not take it for more than 3 days without first talking to your doctor. Based on the dose, more than 250 mg/kg can lead to toxicity and can be potentially fatal. An overdose is capable of causing serious damage to the liver and kidneys. Inform your doctor immediately if you think you have given too much of this medicine to your child, even if your child seems well, because of the risk of delayed, serious liver damage.
Is there any special diet my child needs to follow while taking this medicine?
Unless instructed by your doctor, your child should take a normal balanced diet while continuing this medicine as lack of nutrition can put your child at risk of developing medicinal toxicity.
Where should I store this medicine?
Keep this medicine at room temperature in a dry place beyond the reach of the children.
In what conditions Sumo L DS Suspension must be given with caution?

It is advised to use Sumo L DS Suspension with caution if the child has malnutrition, G6PD deficiency, liver disease, or any medicinal allergy. So, do not hesitate to share your child’s complete medical history with the doctor as that will help the doctor decide whether the medicine is safe for your child or not.
Can I give Sumo L DS Suspension on a routine basis when my child is taking a vaccine?

Sumo L DS Suspension usually do not interfere with the ingredients in vaccines or cause a bad reaction in a child who has just been vaccinated. However, it is best if you let your child recover from the ongoing illness and finish the course of the medicine As soon as a child is feeling better the vaccine can and should be given.

faq: What is Zerodol-SP Tablet?

It is a combination of three medicines: Aceclofenac, Paracetamol, and Serratiopeptidase. This medication helps in relieving pain and inflammation. It works by lowering the levels of chemical substances in the body that cause pain and inflammation.
Is it safe to take Zerodol-SP Tablet?

It is safe to take this medicine for most of the patients. However, in some patients, it may cause unwanted side effects like nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, heartburn, and diarrhea. If you experience any persistent problem due to the medication, inform your doctor as soon as possible.
Can I stop taking Zerodol-SP Tablet when my pain is relieved?
This medicine is usually used for the short term and can be discontinued when your pain is relieved. However, continued taking it if your doctor has advised you to do so.
Can Zerodol-SP Tablet cause nausea and vomiting?

Yes, the use of this medicine can cause nausea and vomiting. In case you experience nausea while taking this medicine, take it with milk, food, or with antacids. Avoid taking fatty or fried foods along with this medication. In case of vomiting, drink plenty of water or other fluids by taking small frequent sips. Talk to your doctor if vomiting persists and you notice signs of dehydration, like dark colored and strong-smelling urine and a low frequency of urination. Do not take any other medicines without speaking to your doctor.
Can Zerodol-SP Tablet cause dizziness?

Yes, the use of this medicine can cause dizziness (feeling faint, weak, unsteady or lightheaded) in some patients. If you feel dizzy or lightheaded, it is better to rest for sometime and resume once you feel better.
Are there any specific contraindications associated with taking Zerodol-SP Tablet?

The use of this medicine is considered harmful for patients with known allergy to any of the components or excipients of this medicine or in patients with known allergy to other painkillers (NSAIDs). Its use should preferably be avoided in patients with a history of stomach ulcers or in patients with active, recurrent stomach ulcers/bleeding. It should also be avoided in patients with a history of heart failure, high blood pressure, and liver or kidney disease.
Can I take Zerodol-SP Tablet with vitamin B-complex?
Yes, this medicine can be taken with vitamin B-complex preparations. While it helps to relieve pain, vitamin B-complex can help to correct the vitamin deficiency that might be causing your symptoms.
Can the use of Zerodol-SP Tablet cause damage to kidneys?

Yes, long-term use of this medicine can cause damage to the kidneys. Normal kidneys produce a chemical called prostaglandins that protect them from damage. The use of painkillers lowers the levels of prostaglandins in the body, which leads to kidney damage on long-term use. The use of painkillers is not recommended in patients with underlying kidney disease.
Can I take a higher dose of Zerodol-SP Tablet than recommended?

No, taking a higher than recommended dose can lead to increased chances of side effects. If you are experiencing increased severity of pain or the pain is not relieved by the recommended doses, please consult your doctor for re-evaluation.
What are the instructions for storage and disposal of Zerodol-SP Tablet?

Keep this medicine in the packet or the container it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.

Zerodol-P Tablet is a combination of two medicines: Aceclofenac and Paracetamol. This medication helps in relieving pain and inflammation. It works by lowering the levels of chemical substances in the body that cause pain and inflammation.
Is it safe to use Zerodol-P Tablet?

Zerodol-P Tablet is safe for most of the patients. However, in some patients it may cause some unwanted common side effects like nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, heartburn, diarrhea and other uncommon and rare side effects.
Can I stop taking Zerodol-P Tablet when my pain is relieved?

If you are using the medication for a condition associated with long-term pain then Zerodol-P Tablet should be continued for as long as advised by your physician. It can be discontinued if you are using it for short-term pain relief.
Can the use of Zerodol-P Tablet cause nausea and vomiting?

Yes, the use of Zerodol-P Tablet can cause nausea and vomiting. Taking it with milk, food or with antacids can prevent nausea. Avoid taking fatty or fried foods along with this medication. In case of vomiting drink plenty of water or other fluids by taking small frequent sips. Talk to your doctor if vomiting persists and you notice signs of dehydration, like dark colored and strong-smelling urine and a low frequency of urination. Do not take any other medicine without speaking to your doctor.
Can the use of Zerodol-P Tablet cause dizziness?

Yes, the use of Zerodol-P Tablet can cause dizziness (feeling faint, weak, unsteady or lightheaded) in some patients. If you feel dizzy or lightheaded, it is better to rest for sometime and resume once you feel better.
Are there any specific contraindications associated with the use of Zerodol-P Tablet?

The use of Zerodol-P Tablet is considered to be harmful for patients with known allergy to any of the components or excipients of this medicine or in patients with known allergy to other painkillers (NSAIDs). It should preferably be avoided in patients with a history of stomach ulcers or in patients with active, recurrent stomach ulcer/bleeding. It should also be avoided in patients with a history of heart failure, high blood pressure, and liver or kidney disease.
Can Zerodol-P Tablet be taken with vitamin B-complex?

Yes, Zerodol-P Tablet can be taken with vitamin B-complex preparations. While Zerodol-P Tablet helps to relieve pain, vitamin B-complex can help to correct the vitamin deficiency that might be causing the underlying painful condition.
Is Zerodol-P Tablet helpful in relieving stomach pain?
No, Zerodol-P Tablet preferably should not be taken for stomach pain without consulting a physician. This drug can increase stomach acid secretion which may aggravate an unknown underlying condition.
Can the use of Zerodol-P Tablet cause damage to kidneys?

Yes, the long-term use of Zerodol-P Tablet can cause damage to the kidneys. Normal kidneys produce a chemical messenger called prostaglandins that protects them from damage. Fevastin Injection should be administered under the supervision of a trained healthcare professional or a doctor only. It should not be self-administered. What if I vomit after taking Fevastin Injection?

If you vomit in less than 30 minutes after having a dose of Fevastin Injection tablets or syrup, retake the same dose again. If you vomit after 30 minutes of a dose, you do not need to take another one until the next standard dose.
What are the serious side effects of taking an excess of the Fevastin Injection?

Overdose of Fevastin Injectione may cause severe life-threatening liver injury. Taking more than the prescribed dose may also cause kidney injury, decreased platelet count, and even coma. Early symptoms of an overdose include nausea, vomiting, and general tiredness. Immediately consult a doctor or reach an emergency in case of a suspected overdose.
When will I feel better after taking the Fevastin Injection?
Usually, you will start feeling better after about half an hour of taking a Fevastin Injection.
Is Fevastin Injection an antibiotic?

Is Fevastin Injection safe for children?
Fevastin Injection is considered safe for children only when used as directed by the doctor.
Can I take Fevastin Injection and ibuprofen together?
Ibuprofen and Fevastin Injection are safe medicines, but both should not be used together. Consult your doctor if you are not sure.

No, Fevastin Injection does not make babies sleepy. It is a pain-relieving medicine that is also used to control high fever.

faq: What is Sinarest New Tablet?

Sinarest New Tablet is a combination of three medicines: Chlorpheniramine, Paracetamol / Acetaminophen and Phenylephrine. This combination helps to relieve symptoms of cold like runny nose, watery eyes, fever and headache. Chlorpheniramine is an antiallergic. It relieves allergy symptoms like runny nose, watery eyes and sneezing. Paracetamol blocks the release of certain chemical messengers in the brain that are responsible for pain and fever. Phenylephrine is a decongestant which narrows the small blood vessels and provides relief from congestion or stuffiness in the nose.
Is it safe to use Sinarest New Tablet?

Yes, Sinarest New Tablet is safe in most patients. However, in some patients it may cause common side effects like nausea, vomiting, allergic reaction, sleepiness, headache and other uncommon or rare side effects. Inform the doctor if you experience any persistent problem while taking this medicine.
Can I stop taking Sinarest New Tablet when I am relieved of my symptoms?
Sinarest New Tablet is usually used for short term and can be discontinued when your symptoms are relieved. However, continue taking this medicine if your doctor has advised you to do so.
Can the use of Sinarest New Tablet cause dizziness?

Yes, the use of Sinarest New Tablet can cause dizziness (feeling faint, weak, unsteady or lightheaded) in some patients. If you feel dizzy or lightheaded, it is better to rest for some time and resume once you feel better.
Can the use of Sinarest New Tablet cause damage to liver?

Sinarest New Tablet is usually safe when taken according to the recommended dose. However, an overdose of Sinarest New Tablet can damage your liver. Avoid drinking alcohol, while taking this medicine as it may increase your risk of liver damage.
What is the recommended storage condition for the Sinarest New Tablet?

Keep this medicine in the container or the pack it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.

faq: How much Dolo Drops should I give to my child?

Always follow your doctor's instructions regarding how much of the medicine to give and how often to give it. This depends on the strength of the medicine and the age of your child. You may also check the label or the leaflet inside the packaging for directions before use. The commonly recommended dose is 10-15 mg/kg per dose every 4 to 6 hours. In case you are not sure how much to give, consult your child’s doctor.
When will my child’s condition improve after taking Dolo Drops?

Dolo Drops usually starts working within 30 to 60 mins of intake and shows its peak effect within 3 to 4 hours. Your child may start to feel better after a few doses. In case the pain or fever persists longer, consult your child’s doctor immediately.
My child vomited after taking Dolo Drops. What should I do?

Dolo Drops usually starts working within 30 to 60 mins of intake and shows its peak effect within 3 to 4 hours. Your child may start to feel better after a few doses. In case the pain or fever persists longer, consult your child’s doctor immediately.
Can I give Dolo Drops to my child for low-grade fever?
You can give this medicine if your child has a temperature of 38.3°C (101°F) or higher. But, you must always try to speak to your child’s doctor first.
My child’s fever is persistent even after taking Dolo Drops. What should I do?
If the fever doesn't come down after the initial few doses, the cause might be an infection (virus or bacteria). It is advised to consult your child’s doctor for specific treatment.
How much of Dolo Drops is considered as an overdose?

You should only take four doses of Dolo Drops in 24 hours. There should be a gap of at least 4-6 hours between two doses. Do not take it for more than 3 days without first talking to your doctor. Based on the dose, more than 250 mg/kg can lead to toxicity and can be potentially fatal. An overdose is capable of causing serious damage to the liver and kidneys. Inform your doctor immediately if you think you have given too much of this medicine to your child, even if your child seems well, because of the risk of delayed, serious liver damage.
Is there any special diet my child needs to follow while taking this medicine?
Unless instructed by your doctor, your child should take a normal balanced diet while continuing this medicine as lack of nutrition can put your child at risk of developing medicinal toxicity.
Where should I store this medicine?
Keep this medicine at room temperature in a dry place beyond the reach of the children.
In what conditions Dolo Drops must be given with caution?

It is advised to use Dolo Drops with caution if the child has malnutrition, G6PD deficiency, liver disease, or any medicinal allergy. So, do not hesitate to share your child’s complete medical history with the doctor as that will help the doctor decide whether the medicine is safe for your child or not.
Can I give Dolo Drops on a routine basis when my child is taking a vaccine?
It is always suggested not to give Dolo Drops with vaccines that lead to fever. Rendering to the studies, doing so can reduce the efficacy of the vaccine.

faq: Is it safe to use Combiflam Tablet?

Combiflam Tablet is safe for most patients. However, in some patients, it may cause some unwanted side effects like nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, heartburn and diarrhea. Inform your doctor if you experience any persistent problem due to this medication.
Can I stop taking Combiflam Tablet when my pain is relieved?

Combiflam Tablet should be continued as advised by your doctor, if you are using the medicine for a condition associated with long-term pain. It can be discontinued if you are using it for short-term pain relief.
Can the use of Combiflam Tablet cause nausea and vomiting?

Yes, the use of Combiflam Tablet may cause nausea and vomiting. Taking it with milk, food or antacids can prevent nausea. Avoid taking fatty or fried foods along with this medication. In case of vomiting, drink plenty of water or other fluids by taking small frequent sips. Talk to your doctor if vomiting persists and you notice signs of dehydration, like dark colored and strong-smelling urine or a low frequency of urination. Do not take any other medicines without speaking to your doctor.
Can the use of Combiflam Tablet cause dizziness?

Yes, the use of Combiflam Tablet can cause dizziness (feeling faint, weak, unsteady or lightheaded) in some patients. If you feel dizzy or lightheaded, do not drive or use any machines. It is better to rest for sometime and resume once you feel better.
Are there any specific contraindications associated with the use of Combiflam Tablet?

The use of Combiflam Tablet is considered to be harmful for patients with known allergy to any of the components of this medicine. It should be avoided in patients with known allergy to other painkillers (NSAIDs). The use of this medicine should preferably be avoided in patients with a history of stomach ulcers or in patients with active or recurrent stomach ulcer/bleeding. It should also be avoided in patients with history of heart failure, high blood pressure, and liver or kidney disease.
Is Combiflam Tablet helpful in relieving stomach pain?
No, Combiflam Tablet should not be taken for stomach pain without consulting a physician. This drug can increase stomach acid secretion which may aggravate an unknown underlying condition.
Can the use of Combiflam Tablet cause damage to kidneys?

Yes, the long-term use of Combiflam Tablet can cause damage to the kidneys. Normal kidneys produce a chemical called prostaglandins that protect the kidneys from damage. Use of painkillers lowers the levels of prostaglandins in the body, leading to kidney damage because of long-term use. Therefore, the use of painkillers is not recommended in patients with underlying kidney disease.
Is it safe to take a higher than the recommended dose of Combiflam Tablet ?

No, taking a higher than the recommended dose of Combiflam Tablet can increase the risks of side effects like nausea, vomiting, heartburn, indigestion and diarrhea. In fact, using this medicine for a long-term can also damage your kidneys on long-term use. If you are experiencing increased severity of pain or if the pain is not relieved by the recommended doses of this medicine, please consult your doctor for re-evaluation.

No, P 500 Tablet is not an antibiotic. It works as a painkiller and fever-reducing medicine.
Can I take P 500 Tablet and ibuprofen together?
Ibuprofen and P 500 Tablet are safe medicines, but both should not be used together. Consult your doctor if you are not sure.
How long does a P 500 Tablet take to work?

P 500 Tablet takes around 30-45 min to start working and show its effects. It is advised to take this medicine for the duration suggested by the doctor. Consult your doctor if you experience any bothersome side effects.
What are the serious side effects of taking an excess of the P 500 Tablet?

Overdose of P 500 Tablete may cause severe life-threatening liver injury. Taking more than the prescribed dose may also cause kidney injury, decreased platelet count, and even coma. Early symptoms of an overdose include nausea, vomiting, and general tiredness. Immediately consult a doctor or reach an emergency in case of a suspected overdose.

faq: Is it safe to use Brufen 400 Tablet?

Brufen 400 Tablet is safe for most patients. However, in some patients, it may cause some unwanted side effects like nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, heartburn and diarrhea. Inform your doctor if you experience any persistent problem due to this medication.
What should I tell my doctor before starting treatment with Brufen 400 Tablet?

Before starting treatment with Brufen 400 Tablet, tell your doctor if you have any other health problems, like kidney or liver-related issues. This is because certain medical conditions may affect your treatment and you may even need dose modifications. Let your doctor know about all the other medicines you are taking because they may affect, or be affected by, this medicine. Inform your doctor if you are planning a baby, if you are pregnant or breastfeeding.
What if I forget to take a dose of Brufen 400 Tablet?

If you forget a dose of Brufen 400 Tablet, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take the next scheduled dose in the prescribed time. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one as this may increase the chances of developing side effects.
Can I stop taking Brufen 400 Tablet when my pain is relieved?

Brufen 400 Tablet should be continued as advised by your doctor, if you are using the medicine for a condition associated with long-term pain. It can be discontinued if you are using it for short-term pain relief.
Can the use of Brufen 400 Tablet cause nausea and vomiting?

Yes, the use of Brufen 400 Tablet may cause nausea and vomiting. Taking it with milk, food or antacids can prevent nausea. Avoid taking fatty or fried foods along with this medication. In case of vomiting, drink plenty of water or other fluids by taking small frequent sips. Talk to your doctor if vomiting persists and you notice signs of dehydration, like dark colored and strong-smelling urine or a low frequency of urination. Do not take any other medicines without speaking to your doctor.
Are there any specific contraindications associated with the use of Brufen 400 Tablet?

The use of Brufen 400 Tablet is considered to be harmful for patients with known allergy to any of the components of this medicine. It should be avoided in patients with known allergy to other painkillers (NSAIDs). The use of this medicine should preferably be avoided in patients with a history of stomach ulcers or in patients with active or recurrent stomach ulcer/bleeding. It should also be avoided in patients with a history of heart failure, high blood pressure, and liver or kidney disease.
Is Brufen 400 Tablet helpful in relieving stomach pain?
No, Brufen 400 Tablet should not be taken for stomach pain without consulting a physician. This drug can increase stomach acid secretion which may aggravate an unknown underlying condition.
Can the use of Brufen 400 Tablet cause damage to kidneys?

Yes, the long-term use of Brufen 400 Tablet can cause damage to the kidneys. Normal kidneys produce a chemical called prostaglandins that protect the kidneys from damage. Use of painkillers lowers the levels of prostaglandins in the body, leading to kidney damage because of long-term use. Therefore, the use of painkillers is not recommended in patients with underlying kidney disease.
Is it safe to take a higher than the recommended dose of Brufen 400 Tablet?

No, taking a higher than the recommended dose of Brufen 400 Tablet can increase the risks of side effects like nausea, vomiting, heartburn, indigestion and diarrhea. In fact, using this medicine for a long-term can also damage your kidneys on long-term use. If you are experiencing increased severity of pain or if the pain is not relieved by the recommended doses of this medicine, please consult your doctor for re-evaluation.
Can Brufen 400 Tablet cause dizziness?

Yes, Brufen 400 Tablet can cause dizziness (feeling faint, weak, unsteady or lightheaded) in some patients. If you feel dizzy or lightheaded, do not drive or use any machines. It is better to rest for sometime and resume once you feel better.

faq: Is Rantac 150 Tablet safe for long-term use?

There is limited data available on whether Rantac 150 Tablet can be used for the long term or not, but it is a relatively safe medicine. You should take it for the duration advised by your doctor. Do not take over-the-counter Rantac 150 Tablet for longer than 2 weeks unless advised by your doctor.
Can I take Rantac 150 Tablet empty stomach?
Rantac 150 Tablet may be taken with or without food. It can be taken once daily before bedtime or twice daily in the morning and before bedtime, as recommended.
Is Rantac 150 Tablet effective?

Rantac 150 Tablet would be effective only if used for the right indication in the dose and the duration as advised by the doctor. In case you do not find any change in your condition while taking this medicine, please talk to your doctor. Do not change the dose or stop taking the medicine without consulting your doctor.
What are the dos and don’ts while taking Rantac 150 Tablet?

Avoid taking aspirin and other painkillers used to treat arthritis, period pain, or headache. These medicines may irritate the stomach and make your condition worse. Contact your doctor who may suggest other medicines. Avoid coffee, tea, cocoa, and cola drinks because these contain ingredients that may irritate your stomach. Eat smaller, more frequent meals. Eat slowly and chew your food carefully. Try not to rush while having meals. You should stop or cut down on smoking.
Can I take alcohol with Rantac 150 Tablet?
Alcohol does not interfere with the working of Rantac 150 Tablet. But, you should avoid taking alcohol as it may further damage the stomach, delaying your recovery.
How long does it take for Rantac 150 Tablet to start working?
Rantac 150 Tablet starts working as fast as 15 minutes from when it is given. Its effect is seen to last all day or all night.
What is the difference between Rantac 150 Tablet and omeprazole?

Rantac 150 Tablet and Omeprazole belong to different groups of medicines. While Rantac 150 Tablet belongs to histamine H2 antagonists group, Omeprazole belongs to proton pump inhibitors group. These medicines (Rantac 150 Tablet and Omeprazole) work by reducing the amount of acid made by the stomach, to give relief of symptoms and allow healing to take place.

faq: What are the instructions for storage and disposal of Rantac-Dom Tablet?

Keep this medicine in the container or the pack it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.
What is the best time to take Rantac-Dom Tablet?

Take Rantac-Dom Tablet exactly as directed by your doctor. It can be taken with or without food. To prevent heartburn and acid indigestion, take it 30-60 minutes before eating food or drinking beverages as that can lead to indigestion. Follow all directions as advised.
What are the serious side effects of an overdose of Rantac-Dom Tablet?

Serious side effects are rare but can occur if you take a higher than the recommended dose. You could have stomach pain that seems to be getting worse (sign of an inflamed liver or pancreas), back pain, fever, pain while peeing or blood in your urine (signs of kidney problems), rash and a slow or irregular heartbeat.
Can the use of Rantac-Dom Tablet cause dryness in mouth?

Yes, the use of Rantac-Dom Tablet can cause dry mouth. If you experience dry mouth, drink plenty of water. Take regular sips during the day and keep some water by your bed at night. You may use lip balm if your lips are also dry.
Can I take Rantac-Dom Tablet if I am pregnant?

Speak with your doctor if you conceive while taking Rantac-Dom Tablet. Let your doctor know even if you are planning a baby. Some studies have shown that its use is unsafe during pregnancy as it may harm the fetus.
Can I drink alcohol with Rantac-Dom Tablet?
No, alcohol is usually avoided while taking Rantac-Dom Tablet as it may make your stomach produce more acid than normal. This can irritate your stomach lining and make your symptoms worse.

faq: What is Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule?

Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule is a combination of two medicines: Domperidone and Rabeprazole. This combination is used to treat acidity and heartburn or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD); a condition where the acid in the stomach flows back up into the food pipe (esophagus). It is also used to treat gastric and duodenal ulcers. Domperidone helps to control vomiting by increasing the movement of the gut, allowing the food to move more easily through the stomach.
What are the contraindications of Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule?

The use of Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule is considered to be harmful for patients with a known hypersensitivity to rabeprazole or domperidone or any other inactive ingredients of the medicine. Caution is advised in patients with underlying kidney or liver disease.
Can the use of Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule cause dry mouth?

Yes, the use of Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule can cause dry mouth. Dryness of mouth occurs due to Domperidone. If you experience dry mouth, drink plenty of water. Keep some water on your bedside at night. Cut down the intake of alcohol and avoid smoking. If you have dry mouth, try to use alcohol-free mouthwash as its use can increase the risk of tooth decay.
Can the use of Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule cause diarrhea?

Yes, the use of Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule can cause diarrhea. In case you experience diarrhea, drink plenty of water or other fluids. Avoid taking fatty or fried foods along with this medication. Talk to your doctor if diarrhea persists and if you notice any signs of dehydration, like less urination with dark colored and strong-smelling urine.
What is the recommended storage condition for Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule?

Keep this medicine in the container or the pack it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.
Is it safe to use Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule?

Yes, Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule is safe for most of the patients. However, in some patients it may cause common side effects like diarrhea, stomach pain, flatulence, dryness in mouth, dizziness, headache and other uncommon and rare side effects. Inform your doctor if you experience any persistent problem while taking this medicine.
What is the best time to take Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule?
It is best to take Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule before the first meal of the day or on an empty stomach.
Can the use of Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule cause abnormal heartbeat?

Yes, the use of Rantac RD 30mg/20mg Capsule can increase the risk of developing irregular heartbeat (serious arrhythmias). This is a serious side effect but the chance that it may happen is very low. The risk may be slightly higher in those who are more than 60 years of age.

faq: Will a higher than the recommended dose of Rantac Mps LA Oral Suspension be more effective?

No, taking a higher than the recommended dose may not be more effective, rather it may increase the chances of having serious side effects and toxicity. If the recommended doses do not relieve your symptoms or there is an increased severity of your symptoms, please consult your doctor.
What if I miss a dose?
Take the missed dose as soon as you remember. But, skip the missed dose if it is time for your next dose. Then follow your normal routine.
Can the use of Rantac Mps LA Oral Suspension cause diarrhea?

Yes, the use of Rantac Mps LA Oral Suspension can cause diarrhea. In case of diarrhea, drink plenty of water or other fluids. Talk to your doctor if diarrhea persists and you notice any signs of dehydration, like less urination with dark colored and strong-smelling urine. Do not take any other medicine without consulting your doctor.
Can the use of Rantac Mps LA Oral Suspension cause constipation?

Yes, the use of Rantac Mps LA Oral Suspension can cause constipation. To prevent constipation, eat high-fiber foods like vegetables, fruits, and cereals. Drink plenty of water. Exercise regularly by engaging in activities like swimming, jogging or taking a short walk. Talk to your doctor about if persistent constipation occurs.
What are the instructions for the storage and disposal of Rantac Mps LA Oral Suspension?

Keep this medicine in the container it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.

faq: What is Rantac R Tablet used for?

Rantac R Tablet is used for the treatment of stomach and intestinal ulcers (gastric and duodenal ulcers), reflux esophagitis, or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). It works by reducing the amount of acid made by your stomach and thus relieves your symptoms. Rantac R Tablet also prevents acidity associated with the use of painkillers and stress ulcers in critically ill people. It is also used to treat a disease associated with excessive acid production in the stomach known as Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES).
How long does it take for Rantac R Tablet to work?

Rantac R Tablet starts working within an hour of taking it and shows maximum benefit within two to four hours. You should start feeling better within 2 to 3 days but it may take up to 4 weeks to relieve your symptoms significantly.
What is the best time to take Rantac R Tablet?
It is best to take Rantac R Tablet before your breakfast. If you are taking two doses, take it in the morning and evening. Rantac R Tablet is more effective when it is taken an hour before your food.
Can I stop taking Rantac R Tablet if I feel better?
No, do not stop taking Rantac R Tablet before completing the full course of treatment. You will start to feel better before your treatment is complete.
Does Rantac R Tablet cause bone problems?

Yes, long-term use of Rantac R Tablet can cause thinning of bones, which is called osteoporosis. Rantac R Tablet decreases the calcium absorption leading to calcium deficiency and increases the risk of bone fractures of the hip, wrist, or spine. Take an adequate amount of calcium in your diet or take the supplements as advised by your doctor to avoid any bone problems.
How is Rantac R Tablet useful in the treatment of H. pylori infection?

Rantac R Tablet is used along with antibiotics for the treatment of H.Pylori infection. It works by decreasing stomach acid volume and decreasing breakdown and washout of antibiotics leading to an increased antibiotic concentration and tissue penetration. It also helps in symptomatic relief by decreasing associated acidity, reflux, and heartburn.
Can I take Rantac R Tablet with vitamin D?

Yes, vitamin D can be taken along with Rantac R Tablet. Vitamin D is generally advised to be taken as a supplement with Rantac R Tablet as the long-term use of Rantac R Tablet decreases the absorption of calcium and may lead to calcium deficiency. This can lead to osteoporosis (thinning of bones) and increase the risk of bone fractures like hip, wrist, and spine fractures. Please consult your doctor to know about ways to prevent this.
Can long term use of Rantac R Tablet cause magnesium deficiency?

Long-term use of Rantac R Tablet can lower magnesium levels in patients taking multiple daily doses for 3 months or longer. Get your magnesium levels checked at regular intervals. Tell your doctor if you experience seizures (fits), dizziness, abnormal or fast heartbeat, jitteriness, jerking movements or shaking (tremors), muscle weakness, spasms of the hands and feet, cramps, muscle aches.
Is it safe to use Rantac R Tablet for a long period of time?

Rantac R Tablet should be used for as long as it has been prescribed by your doctor. Rantac R Tablet is usually considered to be safe when taken in the recommended dose and duration. If Rantac R Tablet is used for more than 3 months, certain long-term side effects may be seen. The most important of these is low magnesium levels in your blood, making you feel tired, confused, dizzy, shaky, or dizzy. You may also have muscle twitches or irregular heartbeat. If the use is further prolonged for more than a year, you may have an increased risk of bone fractures, stomach infections, subacute cutaneous lupus erythematosus, osteoporosis, and vitamin B12 deficiency.
Can I take alcohol with Rantac R Tablet?

No, alcohol intake is not advised with Rantac R Tablet. Alcohol itself does not affect the working of Rantac R Tablet, but it can increase acid production. This may further cause worsening of your symptoms.
What dietary changes should I make to get relief from acidity?

Rantac R Tablet is best taken 1 hour before a meal. You should avoid spicy and fatty foods while taking this medicine. It also helps to cut down on caffeinated drinks such as tea, coffee, and cola. Alcohol intake should also be avoided as it may worsen your symptoms.
What other lifestyle changes should I make to get maximum benefit of Rantac R Tablet?

You make see better results if you make certain dietary and lifestyle changes while taking Rantac R Tablet. Exercise regularly and eat healthily. You can consult your dietician to get a diet chart that suits you best. Eat at least 3 hours before sleeping to reduce the chances of aggravation of your symptoms at night. You should avoid spicy and fatty foods while taking this medicine. Refrain from caffeinated drinks such as tea, coffee, and cola. Alcohol intake and smoking should also be avoided as they may worsen your symptoms.
Can I take antacids along with Rantac R Tablet?
Yes, you can take antacids along with Rantac R Tablet. Take it 2 hours before or after you take Rantac R Tablet.

faq: Is Rantac Injection 2ml safe for long-term use?

Do not take over-the-counter Rantac Injection 2ml for longer than 2 weeks unless advised by your doctor.
Is Rantac Injection 2ml effective?

Rantac Injection 2ml would be effective only if used for the right indication in the dose and the duration as advised by the doctor. In case you do not find any change in your condition while taking this medicine, please talk to your doctor. Do not change the dose or stop taking the medicine without consulting your doctor.
What are the dos and don’ts while taking Rantac Injection 2ml?

Avoid taking aspirin and other painkillers used to treat arthritis, period pain, or headache. These medicines may irritate the stomach and make your condition worse. How long does it take for Rantac Injection 2ml to start working?
Rantac Injection 2ml starts working as fast as 15 minutes from when it is given. Its effect is seen to last all day or all night.

There is limited data available on whether Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet can be used for the long term or not, but it is a relatively safe medicine. You should take it for the duration advised by your doctor. Do not take over-the-counter Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet for longer than 2 weeks unless advised by your doctor.
Can I take Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet empty stomach?
Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet may be taken with or without food. It can be taken once daily before bedtime or twice daily in the morning and before bedtime, as recommended.
Is Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet effective?

Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet would be effective only if used for the right indication in the dose and the duration as advised by the doctor. In case you do not find any change in your condition while taking this medicine, please talk to your doctor. Do not change the dose or stop taking the medicine without consulting your doctor.
What are the dos and don’ts while taking Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet?

Avoid taking aspirin and other painkillers used to treat arthritis, period pain, or headache. These medicines may irritate the stomach and make your condition worse. Contact your doctor who may suggest other medicines. Avoid coffee, tea, cocoa, and cola drinks because these contain ingredients that may irritate your stomach. Eat smaller, more frequent meals. Eat slowly and chew your food carefully. Try not to rush while having meals. You should stop or cut down on smoking.
Can I take alcohol with Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet?
Alcohol does not interfere with the working of Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet. But, you should avoid taking alcohol as it may further damage the stomach, delaying your recovery.
How long does it take for Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet to start working?
Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet starts working as fast as 15 minutes from when it is given. Its effect is seen to last all day or all night.
What is the difference between Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet and omeprazole?

Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet and Omeprazole belong to different groups of medicines. While Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet belongs to histamine H2 antagonists group, Omeprazole belongs to proton pump inhibitors group. These medicines (Maxx Rantac 150mg Tablet and Omeprazole) work by reducing the amount of acid made by the stomach, to give relief of symptoms and allow healing to take place.

faq: What is PAN 40 Tablet used for?

PAN 40 Tablet is used for the treatment of peptic ulcer disease, reflux esophagitis or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). PAN 40 Tablet prevents acidity associated with use of painkillers. It is also used to treat a disease associated with excessive acid production in the stomach known as Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES). It works by reducing the amount of acid made by your stomach and thus relieves your symptoms.
How long does it take for PAN 40 Tablet to work?
You should start to feel better within 2 to 3 days. It may take up to 4 weeks for PAN 40 Tablet to work properly so you may still have some symptoms during this time.
Is a single dose of PAN 40 Tablet sufficient?

No, a single dose may not be sufficient. However, with only a few doses of PAN 40 Tablet you may get relief with the symptoms. PAN 40 Tablet is usually needed only for a short term or upto 2 weeks for heartburn, indigestion, acid reflux. However, if need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease and Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES), PAN 40 Tablet may be prescribed for a long term duration as well. Please consult your doctor if you do not feel better even after taking PAN 40 Tablet regularly for 2 weeks as prescribed.
Is PAN 40 Tablet safe?
Yes, PAN 40 Tablet is relatively safe. Most of the people who take PAN 40 Tablet do not get a side effect. It is advised to be taken as directed by the doctor for maximum benefits.
Can I take PAN 40 Tablet for a long term?

PAN 40 Tablet is usually prescribed for short-term use only. However, if the need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease, ZE syndrome, etc. PAN 40 Tablet may be prescribed for a long-term duration as well. Long-term use may carry an increased risk for side effects and must be discussed with the doctor. Please use PAN 40 Tablet as advised by your doctor and under their supervision.
What are the long term side effects of PAN 40 Tablet?

If PAN 40 Tablet is used for more than 3 months, certain long-term side effects may be seen. The most important of these is low magnesium levels in your blood which may make you feel tired, confused, dizzy, shaky, or dizzy. You may also have muscle twitches or irregular heartbeat. If the use is further prolonged for more than a year, you may have an increased risk of bone fractures, stomach infections, and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 deficiency can make you anemic, as a result of which you may feel more tired, weak, or pale. Additionally, you may have palpitations, shortness of breath, lightheadedness, indigestion, loss of appetite, flatulence (gas), or nerve problems such as numbness, tingling, and problem in walking.
What is the best time to take PAN 40 Tablet?

Usually, PAN 40 Tablet is taken once a day, first thing in the morning. If you take PAN 40 Tablet twice a day, take 1 dose in the morning and 1 dose in the evening. The tablets should be swallowed whole (remember not to be chewed or crushed) and taken at least 1 hour before a meal with some water.
Can I stop taking PAN 40 Tablet if I feel better?

If you have been taking PAN 40 Tablet for a long time. Stopping it abruptly may lead to increased acid production, thereby worsening your symptoms. Therefore, you must discuss any dose changes or if you wish to come off PAN 40 Tablet.
Does PAN 40 Tablet cause weight gain?

Although rare but long-term treatment with PAN 40 Tablet may cause weight gain. The reason could be the relief from reflux symptoms which could make you eat more. Consult your doctor for any weight-related concern.
Can I take alcohol with PAN 40 Tablet?

No, alcohol intake is not advised with PAN 40 Tablet. Alcohol itself does not affect the working of PAN 40 Tablet, but it can increase the acid production. This may further cause worsening of your symptoms.
Can I take antacids along with PAN 40 Tablet?
Yes, you can take antacids along with PAN 40 Tablet. Take it 2 hours before or after you take PAN 40 Tablet.
What dietary changes should I make to get relief from acidity?

PAN 40 Tablet is best taken 1 hour before a meal. You should avoid spicy and fatty foods while taking this medicine. You must refrain from caffeinated drinks such as tea, coffee and cola. Alcohol intake should also be avoided as it may worsen your symptoms.
Are painkillers safe to take along with PAN 40 Tablet?

faq: What is Pantocid Tablet used for?

Pantocid Tablet is used for the treatment of peptic ulcer disease, reflux esophagitis or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Pantocid Tablet prevents acidity associated with use of painkillers. It is also used to treat a disease associated with excessive acid production in the stomach known as Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES). It works by reducing the amount of acid made by your stomach and thus relieves your symptoms.
How long does it take for Pantocid Tablet to work?
You should start to feel better within 2 to 3 days. It may take up to 4 weeks for Pantocid Tablet to work properly so you may still have some symptoms during this time.
Is a single dose of Pantocid Tablet sufficient?

No, a single dose may not be sufficient. However, with only a few doses of Pantocid Tablet you may get relief with the symptoms. Pantocid Tablet is usually needed only for a short term or upto 2 weeks for heartburn, indigestion, acid reflux. However, if need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease and Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES), Pantocid Tablet may be prescribed for a long term duration as well. Please consult your doctor if you do not feel better even after taking Pantocid Tablet regularly for 2 weeks as prescribed.
Is Pantocid Tablet safe?
Yes, Pantocid Tablet is relatively safe. Most of the people who take Pantocid Tablet do not get a side effect. It is advised to be taken as directed by the doctor for maximum benefits.
Can I take Pantocid Tablet for a long term?

Pantocid Tablet is usually prescribed for short-term use only. However, if the need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease, ZE syndrome, etc. Pantocid Tablet may be prescribed for a long-term duration as well. Long-term use may carry an increased risk for side effects and must be discussed with the doctor. Please use Pantocid Tablet as advised by your doctor and under their supervision.
What are the long term side effects of Pantocid Tablet?

If Pantocid Tablet is used for more than 3 months, certain long-term side effects may be seen. The most important of these is low magnesium levels in your blood which may make you feel tired, confused, dizzy, shaky, or dizzy. You may also have muscle twitches or irregular heartbeat. If the use is further prolonged for more than a year, you may have an increased risk of bone fractures, stomach infections, and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 deficiency can make you anemic, as a result of which you may feel more tired, weak, or pale. Additionally, you may have palpitations, shortness of breath, lightheadedness, indigestion, loss of appetite, flatulence (gas), or nerve problems such as numbness, tingling, and problem in walking.
What is the best time to take Pantocid Tablet?

Usually, Pantocid Tablet is taken once a day, first thing in the morning. If you take Pantocid Tablet twice a day, take 1 dose in the morning and 1 dose in the evening. The tablets should be swallowed whole (remember not to be chewed or crushed) and taken at least 1 hour before a meal with some water.
Can I stop taking Pantocid Tablet if I feel better?

If you have been taking Pantocid Tablet for a long time. Stopping it abruptly may lead to increased acid production, thereby worsening your symptoms. Therefore, you must discuss any dose changes or if you wish to come off Pantocid Tablet.
Does Pantocid Tablet cause weight gain?

Although rare but long-term treatment with Pantocid Tablet may cause weight gain. The reason could be the relief from reflux symptoms which could make you eat more. Consult your doctor for any weight-related concern.
Can I take alcohol with Pantocid Tablet?

No, alcohol intake is not advised with Pantocid Tablet. Alcohol itself does not affect the working of Pantocid Tablet, but it can increase the acid production. This may further cause worsening of your symptoms.
Can I take antacids along with Pantocid Tablet?
Yes, you can take antacids along with Pantocid Tablet. Take it 2 hours before or after you take Pantocid Tablet.
What dietary changes should I make to get relief from acidity?

Pantocid Tablet is best taken 1 hour before a meal. You should avoid spicy and fatty foods while taking this medicine. You must refrain from caffeinated drinks such as tea, coffee and cola. Alcohol intake should also be avoided as it may worsen your symptoms.
Are painkillers safe to take along with Pantocid Tablet?

Yes, it is safe to take painkillers along with Pantocid Tablet. Pantocid Tablet prevents acidity and stomach ulcers associated with the intake of painkillers. Pantocid Tablet is taken 1 hour before a meal. On the other hand, painkillers are usually taken with, or after a meal to avoid stomach upset.

The tablets should be swallowed whole (remember not to be chewed or crushed) and taken at least 1 hour before a meal with some water.
Can I stop taking Pantakind Tablet if I feel better?

If you have been taking Pantakind Tablet for a long time. Stopping it abruptly may lead to increased acid production, thereby worsening your symptoms. Therefore, you must discuss any dose changes or if you wish to come off Pantakind Tablet.
Does Pantakind Tablet cause weight gain?

Although rare but long-term treatment with Pantakind Tablet may cause weight gain. The reason could be the relief from reflux symptoms which could make you eat more. Consult your doctor for any weight-related concern.
Can I take alcohol with Pantakind Tablet?

No, alcohol intake is not advised with Pantakind Tablet. Alcohol itself does not affect the working of Pantakind Tablet, but it can increase the acid production. This may further cause worsening of your symptoms.
Can I take antacids along with Pantakind Tablet?
Yes, you can take antacids along with Pantakind Tablet. Take it 2 hours before or after you take Pantakind Tablet.
What dietary changes should I make to get relief from acidity?

Pantakind Tablet is best taken 1 hour before a meal. You should avoid spicy and fatty foods while taking this medicine. You must refrain from caffeinated drinks such as tea, coffee and cola. Alcohol intake should also be avoided as it may worsen your symptoms.
Are painkillers safe to take along with Pantakind Tablet?

Yes, it is safe to take painkillers along with Pantakind Tablet. Pantakind Tablet prevents acidity and stomach ulcers associated with the intake of painkillers. Pantakind Tablet is taken 1 hour before a meal. On the other hand, painkillers are usually taken with, or after a meal to avoid stomach upset.

faq: What is Topp 40 Tablet used for?

Topp 40 Tablet is used for the treatment of peptic ulcer disease, reflux esophagitis or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Topp 40 Tablet prevents acidity associated with use of painkillers. It is also used to treat a disease associated with excessive acid production in the stomach known as Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES). It works by reducing the amount of acid made by your stomach and thus relieves your symptoms.
How long does it take for Topp 40 Tablet to work?
You should start to feel better within 2 to 3 days. It may take up to 4 weeks for Topp 40 Tablet to work properly so you may still have some symptoms during this time.
Is a single dose of Topp 40 Tablet sufficient?

No, a single dose may not be sufficient. However, with only a few doses of Topp 40 Tablet you may get relief with the symptoms. Topp 40 Tablet is usually needed only for a short term or upto 2 weeks for heartburn, indigestion, acid reflux. However, if need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease and Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES), Topp 40 Tablet may be prescribed for a long term duration as well. Please consult your doctor if you do not feel better even after taking Topp 40 Tablet regularly for 2 weeks as prescribed.
Is Topp 40 Tablet safe?
Yes, Topp 40 Tablet is relatively safe. Most of the people who take Topp 40 Tablet do not get a side effect. It is advised to be taken as directed by the doctor for maximum benefits.
Can I take Topp 40 Tablet for a long term?

Topp 40 Tablet is usually prescribed for short-term use only. However, if the need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease, ZE syndrome, etc. Topp 40 Tablet may be prescribed for a long-term duration as well. Long-term use may carry an increased risk for side effects and must be discussed with the doctor. Please use Topp 40 Tablet as advised by your doctor and under their supervision.
What are the long term side effects of Topp 40 Tablet?

If Topp 40 Tablet is used for more than 3 months, certain long-term side effects may be seen. The most important of these is low magnesium levels in your blood which may make you feel tired, confused, dizzy, shaky, or dizzy. You may also have muscle twitches or irregular heartbeat. If the use is further prolonged for more than a year, you may have an increased risk of bone fractures, stomach infections, and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 deficiency can make you anemic, as a result of which you may feel more tired, weak, or pale. Additionally, you may have palpitations, shortness of breath, lightheadedness, indigestion, loss of appetite, flatulence (gas), or nerve problems such as numbness, tingling, and problem in walking.

Usually, Topp 40 Tablet is taken once a day, first thing in the morning. If you take Topp 40 Tablet twice a day, take 1 dose in the morning and 1 dose in the evening. No, alcohol intake is not advised with Topp 40 Tablet. Alcohol itself does not affect the working of Topp 40 Tablet, but it can increase the acid production. This may further cause worsening of your symptoms.

Yes, you can take antacids along with Topp 40 Tablet. Take it 2 hours before or after you take Topp 40 Tablet.
What dietary changes should I make to get relief from acidity?

Topp 40 Tablet is best taken 1 hour before a meal. You should avoid spicy and fatty foods while taking this medicine. You must refrain from caffeinated drinks such as tea, coffee and cola. Alcohol intake should also be avoided as it may worsen your symptoms.

Yes, it is safe to take painkillers along with Topp 40 Tablet. Topp 40 Tablet prevents acidity and stomach ulcers associated with the intake of painkillers. Topp 40 Tablet is taken 1 hour before a meal. On the other hand, painkillers are usually taken with, or after a meal to avoid stomach upset.

faq: What are the instructions for storage and disposal of Ganaton Total Capsule SR?

Keep this medicine in the container or the pack it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.
What is the best time to take Ganaton Total Capsule SR?

Take Ganaton Total Capsule SR exactly as directed by your doctor. It is best to take Ganaton Total Capsule SR with or without food. To prevent heartburn and acid indigestion, take it 30-60 minutes before eating food or drinking beverages that can lead to indigestion. Follow all directions as advised.
What are the serious side effects I can have if I overdose on Ganaton Total Capsule SR?

Serious side effects are rare and can occur if you take a higher than the recommended dose of Ganaton Total Capsule SR. You could have stomach pain that seems to be getting worse (sign of an inflamed liver or pancreas), back pain, fever, pain while peeing or blood in your urine (signs of kidney problems), rash and a slow or irregular heartbeat.
Can the use of Ganaton Total Capsule SR cause dryness in mouth?

Yes, the use of Ganaton Total Capsule SR can cause dry mouth. If you experience dry mouth, drink plenty of water. Take regular sips during the day and keep some water by your bed at night. You may use lip balm if your lips are also dry.
Can I take Ganaton Total Capsule SR if I am pregnant?

Speak with your doctor if you conceive while taking Ganaton Total Capsule SR. Let your doctor know even if you are planning a baby. Some studies have shown that its use is unsafe during pregnancy as it may harm the fetus.
Can I  drink alcohol with Ganaton Total Capsule SR?
No, alcohol is usually avoided while taking Ganaton Total Capsule SR as it may makes your stomach produce more acid than normal. This can irritate your stomach lining and make your symptoms worse.

faq: What is Pan-D Capsule PR?

Pan-D Capsule PR is a combination of two medicines: Domperidone and Pantoprazole. This combination is used to treat acidity, heartburn or Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD); a condition where the acid in the stomach flows back up into the food pipe (esophagus). It is also used to treat gastric and duodenal ulcers. On the other hand,  Domperidone helps to control vomiting. It increases the movement of the stomach and intestines which allows the food to move more easily through the stomach.
Is it safe to use Pan-D Capsule PR?

Pan-D Capsule PR is safe for most of the patients. However, in some patients, it may cause common side effects like diarrhea, stomach pain, flatulence, dryness in the mouth, dizziness, headache, and other uncommon and rare side effects. If you experience any persistent problem while taking this medication, inform your doctor.
Are there any specific contraindications associated with the use of Pan-D Capsule PR?

The use of Pan-D Capsule PR is considered to be harmful for patients with a known hypersensitivity to pantoprazole or domperidone or any other inactive ingredients of the medicine. Caution is advised in patients with underlying kidney or liver disease.
Can the use of Pan-D Capsule PR cause dry mouth?

Yes, the use of Pan-D Capsule PR can cause dry mouth. Dryness of mouth occurs due to Domperidone. If you experience dry mouth, drink plenty of water. Take regular sips of water during the day and keep some water on your bedside at night. Cut down the intake of alcohol and avoid smoking. If you have a dry mouth, try to use alcohol-free mouthwash as its use can increase the risk of tooth decay.
Can the use of Pan-D Capsule PR cause diarrhea?

Yes, the use of Pan-D Capsule PR can cause diarrhea. In case, you experience diarrhea, drink plenty of water or other fluids by taking small frequent sips. Avoid taking fatty or fried foods along with this medication. Talk to your doctor if diarrhea persists and you notice signs of dehydration, like less urination with dark colored and strong-smelling urine.
What are the instructions for storage and disposal of Pan-D Capsule PR?

Keep this medicine in the container it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.

faq: What is Pantop Injection used for?

Pantop Injection is used for the treatment of peptic ulcer disease, reflux esophagitis or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Pantop Injection prevents acidity associated with use of painkillers. It is also used to treat a disease associated with excessive acid production in the stomach known as Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES). It works by reducing the amount of acid made by your stomach and thus relieves your symptoms.
Can I take antacids along with Pantop Injection?
Yes, you can take antacids along with Pantop Injection. Take it 2 hours before or after you take Pantop Injection.
How long does it take for Pantop Injection to work?
You should start to feel better within 2 to 3 days. It may take up to 4 weeks for Pantop Injection to work properly so you may still have some symptoms during this time.
Does Pantop Injection cause weight gain?

Although rare but long-term treatment with Pantop Injection may cause weight gain. The reason could be the relief from reflux symptoms which could make you eat more. Consult your doctor for any weight-related concern.
Can I take alcohol with Pantop Injection?

No, alcohol intake is not advised with Pantop Injection. Alcohol itself does not affect the working of Pantop Injection, but it can increase the acid production. This may further cause worsening of your symptoms.
What dietary changes should I make to get relief from acidity?

Pantop Injection is best taken 1 hour before a meal. You should avoid spicy and fatty foods while taking this medicine. You must refrain from caffeinated drinks such as tea, coffee and cola. Alcohol intake should also be avoided as it may worsen your symptoms.
Can I take Pantop Injection for a long term?

Pantop Injection is usually prescribed for short term use only. However, if need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease and Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES), Pantop Injection may be prescribed for a long term duration as well. Long term use may carry an increased risk for side effects and must be discussed with the doctor. Please use Pantop Injection as advised by your doctor and under their supervision.
Are painkillers safe to take along with Pantop Injection?

Yes, it is safe to take painkillers along with Pantop Injection. Pantop Injection prevents acidity and stomach ulcers associated with the intake of painkillers. Pantop Injection is taken 1 hour before a meal. On the other hand, painkillers are usually taken with, or after a meal to avoid stomach upset.
Is a single dose of Pantop Injection sufficient?

No, a single dose may not be sufficient. However, with only a few doses of Pantop Injection you may get relief with the symptoms. Pantop Injection is usually needed only for a short term or upto 2 weeks for heartburn, indigestion, acid reflux. However, if need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease and Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES), Pantop Injection may be prescribed for a long term duration as well. Please consult your doctor if you do not feel better even after taking Pantop Injection regularly for 2 weeks as prescribed.
What are the long term side effects of Pantop Injection?

If Pantop Injection is used for more than 3 months, certain long term side effects may be seen. The most important of these is low magnesium levels in your blood which may make you feel tired, confused, dizzy, shaky or dizzy. You may also have muscle twitches or irregular heartbeat. If the use is further prolonged for more than a year, you may have an increased risk of bone fractures, stomach infections and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 deficiency can make you anemic, as a result of which you may feel more tired, weak, or pale. Additionally you may have palpitations, shortness of breath, lightheadedness, indigestion, loss of appetite, flatulence (gas) or nerve problems such as numbness, tingling and problem in walking.

faq: What is Pantop-D SR Capsule?

Pantop-D SR Capsule is a combination of two medicines: Domperidone and Pantoprazole. This combination is used to treat acidity, heartburn or Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD); a condition where the acid in the stomach flows back up into the food pipe (esophagus). It is also used to treat gastric and duodenal ulcers. On the other hand,  Domperidone helps to control vomiting. It increases the movement of the stomach and intestines which allows the food to move more easily through the stomach.
Is it safe to use Pantop-D SR Capsule?

Pantop-D SR Capsule is safe for most of the patients. However, in some patients, it may cause common side effects like diarrhea, stomach pain, flatulence, dryness in the mouth, dizziness, headache, and other uncommon and rare side effects. If you experience any persistent problem while taking this medication, inform your doctor.
Are there any specific contraindications associated with the use of Pantop-D SR Capsule?

The use of Pantop-D SR Capsule is considered to be harmful for patients with a known hypersensitivity to pantoprazole or domperidone or any other inactive ingredients of the medicine. Caution is advised in patients with underlying kidney or liver disease.
Can the use of Pantop-D SR Capsule cause dry mouth?

Yes, the use of Pantop-D SR Capsule can cause dry mouth. Dryness of mouth occurs due to Domperidone. If you experience dry mouth, drink plenty of water. Take regular sips of water during the day and keep some water on your bedside at night. Cut down the intake of alcohol and avoid smoking. If you have a dry mouth, try to use alcohol-free mouthwash as its use can increase the risk of tooth decay.
Can the use of Pantop-D SR Capsule cause diarrhea?

Yes, the use of Pantop-D SR Capsule can cause diarrhea. In case, you experience diarrhea, drink plenty of water or other fluids by taking small frequent sips. Avoid taking fatty or fried foods along with this medication. Talk to your doctor if diarrhea persists and you notice signs of dehydration, like less urination with dark colored and strong-smelling urine.
What are the instructions for storage and disposal of Pantop-D SR Capsule?

Keep this medicine in the container it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.

faq: What is the best time to take Pantocid L  Capsule SR?
Take Pantocid L  Capsule SR exactly as directed by your doctor. It is best to take one capsule on an empty stomach daily.
What are the contraindications associated with the use of Pantocid L  Capsule SR?
The use of Pantocid L  Capsule SR should be avoided in patients with known allergy to any of the components or excipients of this medicine.
Can the use of Pantocid L  Capsule SR cause dizziness?

Yes, the use of Pantocid L  Capsule SR can cause dizziness (feeling faint, weak, unsteady or lightheaded) in some patients. If you feel dizzy or lightheaded, it is better to rest for some time and resume once you feel better.
Does the use of Pantocid L  Capsule SR lead to increased risk of fractures?

Several studies in adults suggest that Pantocid L  Capsule SR may increase the risk of osteoporosis-related fractures of the hip, wrist or spine. The risk of fracture was more in patients who received high dose. High dose can mean multiple daily doses, and long-term therapy (a year or longer).
