faq: What is Pantakind-DSR Capsule?

Pantakind-DSR Capsule is a combination of two medicines: Domperidone and Pantoprazole. This combination is used to treat acidity, heartburn or Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD); a condition where the acid in the stomach flows back up into the food pipe (esophagus). It is also used to treat gastric and duodenal ulcers. On the other hand,  Domperidone helps to control vomiting. It increases the movement of the stomach and intestines which allows the food to move more easily through the stomach.
Is it safe to use Pantakind-DSR Capsule?

Pantakind-DSR Capsule is safe for most of the patients. However, in some patients, it may cause common side effects like diarrhea, stomach pain, flatulence, dryness in the mouth, dizziness, headache, and other uncommon and rare side effects. If you experience any persistent problem while taking this medication, inform your doctor.
Are there any specific contraindications associated with the use of Pantakind-DSR Capsule?

The use of Pantakind-DSR Capsule is considered to be harmful for patients with a known hypersensitivity to pantoprazole or domperidone or any other inactive ingredients of the medicine. Caution is advised in patients with underlying kidney or liver disease.
Can the use of Pantakind-DSR Capsule cause dry mouth?

Yes, the use of Pantakind-DSR Capsule can cause dry mouth. Dryness of mouth occurs due to Domperidone. If you experience dry mouth, drink plenty of water. Take regular sips of water during the day and keep some water on your bedside at night. Cut down the intake of alcohol and avoid smoking. If you have a dry mouth, try to use alcohol-free mouthwash as its use can increase the risk of tooth decay.
Can the use of Pantakind-DSR Capsule cause diarrhea?

Yes, the use of Pantakind-DSR Capsule can cause diarrhea. In case, you experience diarrhea, drink plenty of water or other fluids by taking small frequent sips. Avoid taking fatty or fried foods along with this medication. Talk to your doctor if diarrhea persists and you notice signs of dehydration, like less urination with dark colored and strong-smelling urine.
What are the instructions for storage and disposal of Pantakind-DSR Capsule?

Keep this medicine in the container it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.

faq: Which is the best time to take Cintodac  Capsule?

Take Cintodac  Capsule exactly as directed by your doctor. It can be taken with or without food. To prevent heartburn and acid indigestion, take it 30-60 minutes before eating food or drinking beverages as that can lead to indigestion. Follow all directions as advised.
What is gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD)?

Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) occurs when the stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus (the tube which connects your mouth and stomach). This backwash (acid reflux) can irritate the lining of your esophagus. Symptoms include chest pain usually after eating, which might be worse at night, and difficulty in swallowing.
Can I take Cintodac  Capsule if I am pregnant?
Speak with your doctor if you conceive or plan on conceiving while taking Cintodac  Capsule. Some studies have shown that it is unsafe to use during pregnancy as it may harm the fetus.
Can I  drink alcohol with Cintodac  Capsule?

No, alcohol is usually avoided while taking Cintodac  Capsule as it may increase the acidity and cause acid reflux in the food pipe (esophagus) causing heartburn (painful burning in chest). This would decrease the effect of this medicine and can aggravate your existing condition.
What are the instructions for the storage and disposal of Cintodac  Capsule?

Keep this medicine in the packet or the container it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.

faq: What is PAN 80mg Tablet used for?

PAN 80mg Tablet is used for the treatment of peptic ulcer disease, reflux esophagitis or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). PAN 80mg Tablet prevents acidity associated with use of painkillers. It is also used to treat a disease associated with excessive acid production in the stomach known as Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES). It works by reducing the amount of acid made by your stomach and thus relieves your symptoms.
How long does it take for PAN 80mg Tablet to work?
You should start to feel better within 2 to 3 days. It may take up to 4 weeks for PAN 80mg Tablet to work properly so you may still have some symptoms during this time.
Is a single dose of PAN 80mg Tablet sufficient?

No, a single dose may not be sufficient. However, with only a few doses of PAN 80mg Tablet you may get relief with the symptoms. PAN 80mg Tablet is usually needed only for a short term or upto 2 weeks for heartburn, indigestion, acid reflux. However, if need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease and Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES), PAN 80mg Tablet may be prescribed for a long term duration as well. Please consult your doctor if you do not feel better even after taking PAN 80mg Tablet regularly for 2 weeks as prescribed.
Is PAN 80mg Tablet safe?
Yes, PAN 80mg Tablet is relatively safe. Most of the people who take PAN 80mg Tablet do not get a side effect. It is advised to be taken as directed by the doctor for maximum benefits.
Can I take PAN 80mg Tablet for a long term?

PAN 80mg Tablet is usually prescribed for short-term use only. However, if the need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease, ZE syndrome, etc. PAN 80mg Tablet may be prescribed for a long-term duration as well. Long-term use may carry an increased risk for side effects and must be discussed with the doctor. Please use PAN 80mg Tablet as advised by your doctor and under their supervision.
What are the long term side effects of PAN 80mg Tablet?

If PAN 80mg Tablet is used for more than 3 months, certain long-term side effects may be seen. The most important of these is low magnesium levels in your blood which may make you feel tired, confused, dizzy, shaky, or dizzy. You may also have muscle twitches or irregular heartbeat. If the use is further prolonged for more than a year, you may have an increased risk of bone fractures, stomach infections, and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 deficiency can make you anemic, as a result of which you may feel more tired, weak, or pale. Additionally, you may have palpitations, shortness of breath, lightheadedness, indigestion, loss of appetite, flatulence (gas), or nerve problems such as numbness, tingling, and problem in walking.
What is the best time to take PAN 80mg Tablet?

Usually, PAN 80mg Tablet is taken once a day, first thing in the morning. If you take PAN 80mg Tablet twice a day, take 1 dose in the morning and 1 dose in the evening. The tablets should be swallowed whole (remember not to be chewed or crushed) and taken at least 1 hour before a meal with some water.
Can I stop taking PAN 80mg Tablet if I feel better?

If you have been taking PAN 80mg Tablet for a long time. Stopping it abruptly may lead to increased acid production, thereby worsening your symptoms. Therefore, you must discuss any dose changes or if you wish to come off PAN 80mg Tablet.
Does PAN 80mg Tablet cause weight gain?

Although rare but long-term treatment with PAN 80mg Tablet may cause weight gain. The reason could be the relief from reflux symptoms which could make you eat more. Consult your doctor for any weight-related concern.
Can I take alcohol with PAN 80mg Tablet?

No, alcohol intake is not advised with PAN 80mg Tablet. Alcohol itself does not affect the working of PAN 80mg Tablet, but it can increase the acid production. This may further cause worsening of your symptoms.
Can I take antacids along with PAN 80mg Tablet?
Yes, you can take antacids along with PAN 80mg Tablet. Take it 2 hours before or after you take PAN 80mg Tablet.
What dietary changes should I make to get relief from acidity?

PAN 80mg Tablet is best taken 1 hour before a meal. You should avoid spicy and fatty foods while taking this medicine. You must refrain from caffeinated drinks such as tea, coffee and cola. Alcohol intake should also be avoided as it may worsen your symptoms.
Are painkillers safe to take along with PAN 80mg Tablet?

Yes, it is safe to take painkillers along with PAN 80mg Tablet. PAN 80mg Tablet prevents acidity and stomach ulcers associated with the intake of painkillers. PAN 80mg Tablet is taken 1 hour before a meal. On the other hand, painkillers are usually taken with, or after a meal to avoid stomach upset.

faq: What is Dompan Tablet?

Dompan Tablet is a combination of two medicines: Domperidone and Pantoprazole. This combination is used to treat acidity, heartburn or Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD); a condition where the acid in the stomach flows back up into the food pipe (esophagus). It is also used to treat gastric and duodenal ulcers. On the other hand,  Domperidone helps to control vomiting. It increases the movement of the stomach and intestines which allows the food to move more easily through the stomach.
Is it safe to use Dompan Tablet?

Dompan Tablet is safe for most of the patients. However, in some patients, it may cause common side effects like diarrhea, stomach pain, flatulence, dryness in the mouth, dizziness, headache, and other uncommon and rare side effects. If you experience any persistent problem while taking this medication, inform your doctor.
Are there any specific contraindications associated with the use of Dompan Tablet?

The use of Dompan Tablet is considered to be harmful for patients with a known hypersensitivity to pantoprazole or domperidone or any other inactive ingredients of the medicine. Caution is advised in patients with underlying kidney or liver disease.
Can the use of Dompan Tablet cause dry mouth?

Yes, the use of Dompan Tablet can cause dry mouth. Dryness of mouth occurs due to Domperidone. If you experience dry mouth, drink plenty of water. Take regular sips of water during the day and keep some water on your bedside at night. Cut down the intake of alcohol and avoid smoking. If you have a dry mouth, try to use alcohol-free mouthwash as its use can increase the risk of tooth decay.
Can the use of Dompan Tablet cause diarrhea?

Yes, the use of Dompan Tablet can cause diarrhea. In case, you experience diarrhea, drink plenty of water or other fluids by taking small frequent sips. Avoid taking fatty or fried foods along with this medication. Talk to your doctor if diarrhea persists and you notice signs of dehydration, like less urination with dark colored and strong-smelling urine.
What are the instructions for storage and disposal of Dompan Tablet?

Keep this medicine in the container it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.

faq: What is Pantop 20 Tablet used for?

Pantop 20 Tablet is used for the treatment of peptic ulcer disease, reflux esophagitis or gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Pantop 20 Tablet prevents acidity associated with use of painkillers. It is also used to treat a disease associated with excessive acid production in the stomach known as Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES). It works by reducing the amount of acid made by your stomach and thus relieves your symptoms.
How long does it take for Pantop 20 Tablet to work?
You should start to feel better within 2 to 3 days. It may take up to 4 weeks for Pantop 20 Tablet to work properly so you may still have some symptoms during this time.
Is a single dose of Pantop 20 Tablet sufficient?

No, a single dose may not be sufficient. However, with only a few doses of Pantop 20 Tablet you may get relief with the symptoms. Pantop 20 Tablet is usually needed only for a short term or upto 2 weeks for heartburn, indigestion, acid reflux. However, if need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease and Zollinger Ellison syndrome (ZES), Pantop 20 Tablet may be prescribed for a long term duration as well. Please consult your doctor if you do not feel better even after taking Pantop 20 Tablet regularly for 2 weeks as prescribed.
Is Pantop 20 Tablet safe?
Yes, Pantop 20 Tablet is relatively safe. Most of the people who take Pantop 20 Tablet do not get a side effect. It is advised to be taken as directed by the doctor for maximum benefits.
Can I take Pantop 20 Tablet for a long term?

Pantop 20 Tablet is usually prescribed for short-term use only. However, if the need arises, such as for treating peptic ulcer disease, ZE syndrome, etc. Pantop 20 Tablet may be prescribed for a long-term duration as well. Long-term use may carry an increased risk for side effects and must be discussed with the doctor. Please use Pantop 20 Tablet as advised by your doctor and under their supervision.
What are the long term side effects of Pantop 20 Tablet?

If Pantop 20 Tablet is used for more than 3 months, certain long-term side effects may be seen. The most important of these is low magnesium levels in your blood which may make you feel tired, confused, dizzy, shaky, or dizzy. You may also have muscle twitches or irregular heartbeat. If the use is further prolonged for more than a year, you may have an increased risk of bone fractures, stomach infections, and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 deficiency can make you anemic, as a result of which you may feel more tired, weak, or pale. Additionally, you may have palpitations, shortness of breath, lightheadedness, indigestion, loss of appetite, flatulence (gas), or nerve problems such as numbness, tingling, and problem in walking.
What is the best time to take Pantop 20 Tablet?

Usually, Pantop 20 Tablet is taken once a day, first thing in the morning. If you take Pantop 20 Tablet twice a day, take 1 dose in the morning and 1 dose in the evening. The tablets should be swallowed whole (remember not to be chewed or crushed) and taken at least 1 hour before a meal with some water.
Can I stop taking Pantop 20 Tablet if I feel better?

If you have been taking Pantop 20 Tablet for a long time. Stopping it abruptly may lead to increased acid production, thereby worsening your symptoms. Therefore, you must discuss any dose changes or if you wish to come off Pantop 20 Tablet.
Does Pantop 20 Tablet cause weight gain?

Although rare but long-term treatment with Pantop 20 Tablet may cause weight gain. The reason could be the relief from reflux symptoms which could make you eat more. Consult your doctor for any weight-related concern.
Can I take alcohol with Pantop 20 Tablet?

No, alcohol intake is not advised with Pantop 20 Tablet. Alcohol itself does not affect the working of Pantop 20 Tablet, but it can increase the acid production. This may further cause worsening of your symptoms.
Can I take antacids along with Pantop 20 Tablet?
Yes, you can take antacids along with Pantop 20 Tablet. Take it 2 hours before or after you take Pantop 20 Tablet.
What dietary changes should I make to get relief from acidity?

Pantop 20 Tablet is best taken 1 hour before a meal. You should avoid spicy and fatty foods while taking this medicine. You must refrain from caffeinated drinks such as tea, coffee and cola. Alcohol intake should also be avoided as it may worsen your symptoms.
Are painkillers safe to take along with Pantop 20 Tablet?

Yes, it is safe to take painkillers along with Pantop 20 Tablet. Pantop 20 Tablet prevents acidity and stomach ulcers associated with the intake of painkillers. Pantop 20 Tablet is taken 1 hour before a meal. On the other hand, painkillers are usually taken with, or after a meal to avoid stomach upset.

Long-term use may carry an increased risk for side effects and must be discussed with the doctor. Please use Pansec Tablet as advised by your doctor and under their supervision.
What are the long term side effects of Pansec Tablet?

If Pansec Tablet is used for more than 3 months, certain long-term side effects may be seen. The most important of these is low magnesium levels in your blood which may make you feel tired, confused, dizzy, shaky, or dizzy. You may also have muscle twitches or irregular heartbeat. If the use is further prolonged for more than a year, you may have an increased risk of bone fractures, stomach infections, and vitamin B12 deficiency. Vitamin B12 deficiency can make you anemic, as a result of which you may feel more tired, weak, or pale. Additionally, you may have palpitations, shortness of breath, lightheadedness, indigestion, loss of appetite, flatulence (gas), or nerve problems such as numbness, tingling, and problem in walking.
What is the best time to take Pansec Tablet?

Usually, Pansec Tablet is taken once a day, first thing in the morning. If you take Pansec Tablet twice a day, take 1 dose in the morning and 1 dose in the evening. The tablets should be swallowed whole (remember not to be chewed or crushed) and taken at least 1 hour before a meal with some water.
Can I stop taking Pansec Tablet if I feel better?

If you have been taking Pansec Tablet for a long time. Stopping it abruptly may lead to increased acid production, thereby worsening your symptoms. Therefore, you must discuss any dose changes or if you wish to come off Pansec Tablet.
Does Pansec Tablet cause weight gain?

Although rare but long-term treatment with Pansec Tablet may cause weight gain. The reason could be the relief from reflux symptoms which could make you eat more. Consult your doctor for any weight-related concern.
Can I take alcohol with Pansec Tablet?

No, alcohol intake is not advised with Pansec Tablet. Alcohol itself does not affect the working of Pansec Tablet, but it can increase the acid production. This may further cause worsening of your symptoms.
Can I take antacids along with Pansec Tablet?
Yes, you can take antacids along with Pansec Tablet. Take it 2 hours before or after you take Pansec Tablet.
What dietary changes should I make to get relief from acidity?

Pansec Tablet is best taken 1 hour before a meal. You should avoid spicy and fatty foods while taking this medicine. You must refrain from caffeinated drinks such as tea, coffee and cola. Alcohol intake should also be avoided as it may worsen your symptoms.
Are painkillers safe to take along with Pansec Tablet?

Yes, it is safe to take painkillers along with Pansec Tablet. Pansec Tablet prevents acidity and stomach ulcers associated with the intake of painkillers. Pansec Tablet is taken 1 hour before a meal. On the other hand, painkillers are usually taken with, or after a meal to avoid stomach upset.

faq: What is Pantocid D Capsule?

Pantocid D Capsule is a combination of two medicines: Domperidone and Pantoprazole. This combination is used to treat acidity, heartburn or Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD); a condition where the acid in the stomach flows back up into the food pipe (esophagus). It is also used to treat gastric and duodenal ulcers. On the other hand,  Domperidone helps to control vomiting. It increases the movement of the stomach and intestines which allows the food to move more easily through the stomach.
Is it safe to use Pantocid D Capsule?

Pantocid D Capsule is safe for most of the patients. However, in some patients, it may cause common side effects like diarrhea, stomach pain, flatulence, dryness in the mouth, dizziness, headache, and other uncommon and rare side effects. If you experience any persistent problem while taking this medication, inform your doctor.
Are there any specific contraindications associated with the use of Pantocid D Capsule?

The use of Pantocid D Capsule is considered to be harmful for patients with a known hypersensitivity to pantoprazole or domperidone or any other inactive ingredients of the medicine. Caution is advised in patients with underlying kidney or liver disease.
Can the use of Pantocid D Capsule cause dry mouth?

Yes, the use of Pantocid D Capsule can cause dry mouth. Dryness of mouth occurs due to Domperidone. If you experience dry mouth, drink plenty of water. Take regular sips of water during the day and keep some water on your bedside at night. Cut down the intake of alcohol and avoid smoking. If you have a dry mouth, try to use alcohol-free mouthwash as its use can increase the risk of tooth decay.
Can the use of Pantocid D Capsule cause diarrhea?

Yes, the use of Pantocid D Capsule can cause diarrhea. In case, you experience diarrhea, drink plenty of water or other fluids by taking small frequent sips. Avoid taking fatty or fried foods along with this medication. Talk to your doctor if diarrhea persists and you notice signs of dehydration, like less urination with dark colored and strong-smelling urine.
What are the instructions for storage and disposal of Pantocid D Capsule?

Keep this medicine in the container it came in, tightly closed. Store it according to the instructions mentioned on the pack or label. Dispose of the unused medicine. Make sure it is not consumed by pets, children and other people.
